### Install Chocolatey in windows

Browse - https://chocolatey.org/

- Open (windows powershell) -> Run as a administrator 

```
Set-ExecutionPolicy Bypass -Scope Process -Force; [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [System.Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol -bor 3072; iex ((New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://community.chocolatey.org/install.ps1'))
```
Check version 

```
choco
```


### Install kubectl in windows

```
choco install kubernetes-cli
```

Check version 

```
kubectl
```

- Now open the c drive ->  users -> batha 
- Note - u will see ur user name. My user name is batha
- create .kube folder if its not there 
- open the vscode -> create a config file 
-  Go to master server execute below command 
```
cat ~/.kube/config
```
- paste in the config file so u can able to connect to kubernetes cluster. It looks like below

```
apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
    #certificate-authority-data: 
    server: https://34.125.202.236:6443   <change your external ip>
    insecure-skip-tls-verify: true         <add this line>  
  name: kubernetes
contexts:
- context:
    cluster: kubernetes
    user: kubernetes-admin
  name: kubernetes-admin@kubernetes
current-context: kubernetes-admin@kubernetes
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: kubernetes-admin
  user:
    client-certificate-data: 
    client-key-data: 
```


- Make sure u opened required security group in the inbound rules 

check nodes from vscode 

```
kubectl get nodes
```
